abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Macedonia - Children and
            Youth Development Project (LIL) were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: 1) the successful delivery of life skills training
            and other relevant modules could be further expanded if
            delivered also within the formal school system; 2)
            non-formal education programs are most-effective (and
            marketable for employment purposes) where official
            certification is provided for these programs; 3) there is a
            need to differentiate between programs for adolescents and
            youth; and 4) demand-driven approaches should be combined
            with national level planning and policy.
